critique: The document is an order from the President to the Secretary of War. It suspends the Secretary from office and transfers all records and property to General Ulysses S. Grant. This action appears to expand executive power, as it is a unilateral decision by the President. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most axes should be neutral.
